author: Socrates
quote: The only true wisdom I possess is knowing that I know nothing.

author: Socrates
quote: I am a citizen, not of Athens, but of the world.

author: Socrates
quote: An unexamined life is not worth living for me.

author: Socrates
quote: To find myself, I think for myself.

author: Socrates
quote: I can't teach anybody anything, I can only make them think.

author: Socrates
quote: My path to success is to multiply my failures.

author: Socrates
quote: I know that I am intelligent, because I know that I know nothing.

author: Socrates
quote: The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what I desire to appear.

author: Socrates
quote: By all means, I marry. If I get a good wife, I will become happy; if I get a bad one, I will become a philosopher.

author: Socrates
quote: My advice is to marry. If I find a good wife, I'll be happy; if not, I'll become a philosopher.

author: Socrates
quote: I cannot teach anyone, but I can make them think.

author: Socrates
quote: My goal is to stir discussion and lead to self-discovery.

author: Socrates
quote: When I am asked for advice, I often answer by asking a question.

author: Socrates
quote: I prefer a man with a mind, not just knowledge.

author: Socrates
quote: My ignorance is more profound than I imagined.

author: Socrates
quote: I strive to live well, not merely to exist.

author: Socrates
quote: I am not an Athenian, nor a Greek, but a citizen of the world.

author: Socrates
quote: My wisdom lies in my ability to question everything.

author: Socrates
quote: I argue for the sake of the argument, to seek truth.

author: Socrates
quote: My only real possession is my character.
